column4: The i386.iso Live CD works on an old Compaq Deskpro 650Mhz/128MB RAM desktop at work, but dumps me to a blank screen with blinking cursor (after sitting at 'configuring some drivers....ok') when I try it on my AMD Athlon 64 at home.
(sorry if someone's already answered....I have scrollback buffer access now  <g>)
the CD needs at least 256 MB RAM... HW-req's not met... X won't start
the thing is, it DID work on the OLD pc, but won't work on the NEW PC (Athlong 64 w/512MB ram)
at least one of us does.  I'm baffled.  :)   Even tried the amd64.iso on the home box, to no avail.
not on the new computer...SiS 760 display adapter

so the Live-CD hardware detection doesn't recognize it, it seems. you could try to switch to the console [alt-ctrl-f1]  and do a manual 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' there to get X running. sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart afterwards to restart X with the new conf
at what point would I issue the ctrl-alt-f1 ?
when you looking at the blinking cursor instaed of a desktop

cuz I tried that last night but got no results.  Will have to retry tonight I guess.  Will sift through wiki etc. as well, as I'm SURE I saw someone else report this problem....just can't FIND the damned post... <g>
i guess there must be even a special boot parameter to use only vesa-VGA
if there is, how would I interrupt the Live CD startup process to pass an arg to the kernel?
right at the beginning, in the boot menu press ESC
ahhh....thanks.  I'll see if I can find a proper parm.  I see alot of   acpi=off  recommendations, but I"m not sure that'd cure what ails me....
